description.hltext_display: 阪神・桧山が２００万ダウンで更改
description.content: 阪神・桧山進次郎外野手が22日、西宮市の球団事務所で契約交渉を行い、今季年俸４２００万円から２００万減となる４０００万円でサインした。桧山は今季、代打を中心に72試合に出場。夏場こそ調子を落としたが、６月４日のオリックス戦で球団新記録となる１０９本目の代打安打を放つなど、随所で勝負強さを発揮した。更改を終えた桧山は「今年優勝できなかったことに悔いが残る。みんなでもう一回チャンピオンフラッグを勝ち取れるように頑張りたい」と来季の抱負を語った。

【서울=뉴시스】김정환 기자 = 한국마이팜제약과 서울 서초동 21세기병원이 부상의 굴레에서 좌절하고 있는 청소년 스포츠유망주 돕기에 나선다.
양측은 내년부터 가정 형편이 어려워 수술을 못 받거나 부득이 약물 치료에만 의존하는 청소년 꿈나무들을 대상으로 무료 수술(21세기병원), 영양제 ‘이라쎈’과 장학금(한국마이팜제약) 등을 지원키로 했다.
대상자는 각 스포츠종목 협회나 국가대표팀 감독, 코치와 사회체육 지도자들의 추천을 받아 선정한다.
청소년 스포츠 유망주 무료 시술은 올림픽 금메달 2연패를 이룬 레슬링 심권호(38), 시드니올림픽 야구 동메달리스트 손민한(35)이 요청해 이뤄졌다.
21세기병원은 보건복지부 전문병원 시범의료기관이다. 척추신경외과, 관절성형외과, 척추통증의학과, 신경과, 내과를 전공한 척추관절 전문의료진 25명이 진료하고 있다. 2003년 개원 이래 10년간 20만건 진료, 3만건 수술을 기록 중이다.
20여년간 척추 수술 집도 5만건 이상을 기록 중인 성 대표원장은 “운동선수들에게 척추 건강은 필수이고, 스포츠 꿈나무들이 역경을 이겨내고 꿈을 이루는 것에 일조하는 것 역시 병원의 역할이라는 생각에 참여하게 됐다”고 밝혔다.
한국마이팜제약은 태반영양제 ‘이라쎈’으로 유명하다. 국가대표 레슬링 선수 출신인 허준영 회장은 “국가대표급 유망주들은 단순한 개인이 아니라 국가의 소중한 자산으로 이들의 인간 승리는 국민에게 희망과 용기를 주는만큼 돕는 것이 당연하다”고 전했다. ace@newsis.com

Ein verheerender Brand hat am frühen Mittwochmorgen in einer Tischlerei in Pennewitz im Ilmkreis einen millionenschweren Schaden verursacht. Hochwertige Maschinen, ein Bürogebäude und mehrere Autos sowie Kleintransporter fielen den Flammen zum Opfer. Die Brandursache ist noch unklar.

Det lyder nÃ¦sten, som om Israel og palÃ¦stinenserne har genfundet fredstangoen fra 1990'erne, nÃ¥r den israelske hÃ¦rs talsmandskontor takker sine palÃ¦stinensiske kolleger for godt samarbejde og lovâ¦

(제주=연합뉴스) 김호천 기자 = 축구 국가대표팀이 22일 오후 제주월드컵경기장에서 미니게임을 하며 훈련을 한 가운데 손흥민이 드리블을 시도하고 있다. 2010.12.22.khc@yna.co.kr
(끝)뉴스의 새 시대, 연합뉴스 Live 모바일 애플리케이션

description.hltext_display: ケーキ１人分＊ケニア支援に

description.content:
Harlequins RL have announced the signing of Hull back-rower Mike Burnett on loan for the 2011 season.
Burnett, 22, is hotly tipped after emerging from the Black and Whites' academy but has struggled for first-team action due to the presence of the likes of Danny Tickle, Craig Fitzgibbon and Willie Manu in Richard Agar's squad.
He has made 36 appearances and also enjoyed a loan spell with Championship side Sheffield Eagles, and Quins coach Rob Powell said: "Mike is a player I have seen play frequently over the last few years. He has always impressed me."
He added: "He has had limited first-team action due to Hull's wealth of talent in the back row, however I know he is hungry for the opportunity and has the mentality and tools to excel down here."
Burnett added: "I'm really excited about it and looking forward to the move. It will be a good test for me playing regularly at Super League level and a good opportunity for me to develop my game.
"Playing at a higher intensity with Quins RL will help me improve my game and hopefully then I can come back to Hull and stake a claim for a regular place in the side."
Agar insists that remains a strong possibility, and told the Airlie Birds' website: "The aim for us at the end of the season will be for us to sit down, review his performances and look to renew his contract, so this is a good challenge for him."

event_or_fact.property: the signing of Hull back-rower Mike Burnett on loan for the 2011 season
I'm really excited about it and looking forward to the move.
Mike is a player I have seen play frequently over the last few years.
He has had limited first-team action due to Hull's wealth of talent in the back row, however I know he is hungry for the opportunity and has the mentality and tools to excel down here.

麻木、Ｗ不倫認めた！でも１カ月前に破局…

description.content:
특수가스 전문생산업체인 OCI머티리얼즈가 반도체 및 액정표시장치(LCD) 제조공정의 세정가스로 사용되는 NF3(삼불화질소) 제5공장 증설을 추진한다.
OCI머티리얼즈는 총 1700억원을 투자해 경북 영주공장 내에 연산 3000t 규모의 NF3 제5공장 증설을 추진한다고 22일 밝혔다.
이번 달부터 시작되는 증설은 내년 9월까지 1단계 공사를 마무리해 1000t을 추가 생산할 수 있는 설비를 갖춘 후, 시장 수요를 감안해 나머지 2000t을 생산할 수 있도록 단계적으로 실시된다.
내년 1·4분기 중 완공 예정인 연산 3000t 규모의 제4공장 건설에 이은 이번 증설로 OCI머티리얼즈는 특수가스 시장의 선도업체로서의 입지를 더욱 확고히 다지게 될 전망이다.
OCI머티리얼즈 관계자는 “전방산업인 반도체, LCD 패널 시장이 지속적으로 확대될 것으로 예측되고 있어, 증대되는 NF3 수요에 대응하기 위해 선도적 투자에 나서게 됐다”며 “이번 증설로 고객사에 대해 안정적인 공급량을 유지할 수 있고, 규모의 경제를 통한 원가경쟁력도 유지할 수 있다. 시장 1위 사업자로서의 위치를 더욱 공고히 할 것”이라고 말했다.
OCI머티리얼즈는 2001년 특수가스 불모지인 국내에서 첫 NF3를 생산한 이래 지속적인 설비확장을 통해 2009년 말부터 생산량 및 시장점유율에서 세계 1위 자리를 유지하고 있다.
한편 OCI머티리얼즈는 LCD 패널 공장이 경쟁적으로 건설되고 있는 중국에도 연산 1000t 규모의 NF3공장 건설을 추진하고 있어 중국 특수가스 시장도 선도해 나갈 것으로 예상되고 있다.
/win5858@fnnews.com김성원기자
※ 저작권자 ⓒ 파이낸셜뉴스. 무단 전재-재배포 금지

description.hltext_display: Christina teachers put brakes on plans
description.author: NICHOLE DOBO
description.content:
Next Page 1 | 2 Previous Page The teachers union has not signed on to plans due today to resurrect two failing schools as part of the state's Race to the Top reform. The union president blamed a communication breakdown.
"It is the position of the Christina Education Association that the district has involved us in a process that, while cordial, was not a true partnership," Claudia Bock, president of the group, said in a a 690-word letter sent to Superintendent Marcia Lyles on Friday.
District officials disagree, saying many stakeholders, including the union, were involved in the decision-making process.
If the union and district don't come to an agreement by the first week in January, the state Department of Education will be required to step in, a move that could usher in reform models viewed by the teachers union as less desirable, such as replacing at least half the school's staff.
Problems reaching an agreement at Christina are the first visible sign of friction with the union in Delaware. Education reform has taken a more cooperative tone in the First State than in neighboring New Jersey, where town hall meetings with that state's governor, Chris Christie, have turned into shouting matches.
Two Christina schools -- Stubbs Elementary and Glasgow High School -- are among four chosen to take part in reform efforts under a federal Race to the Top-funded initiative called Partnership Zones. New Castle County Vo-Tech's Howard High School of Technology and Positive Outcomes Charter School in Camden also are taking part in the program for schools that have had low student scores on math and reading exams.
As part of the Partnership Zones effort, the state will restructure 10 schools over the next four years. The effort is funded by $2.2 million of the state's $119 million federal Race to the Top grant.
Schools receive as much as $700,000 in money and technical assistance. But first, districts must write a state-approved plan and negotiate work rules with the union.
Both Howard High School and Positive Outcomes submitted plans by the deadline without public push-back from staff or parents. A union agreement was reached in November at Howard High. Positive Outcomes is not unionized.(2 of 2)Christina, the largest of the state's 19 districts, will submit a "final draft plan" to the state by today. The union could submit its own proposal. The Christina union contends Lyles failed to begin negotiating the work rules in enough time to meet today's deadline. Bock also said teachers felt left out of the decision-making process, and the plans submitted to deal with cultural competency issues included "inflammatory and offensive" wording.
The school district disputes the union's version of events. Lyles declined to be interviewed for this story. Through a spokeswoman, she issued a statement: "We have responded to the letter, and we have continued our negotiations with the Christina Education Association. Although we were not in agreement with most of the statements made in the letter, particularly around the collaborative process, we are hopeful that we will come to an agreement on the [memorandum of understanding] for Glasgow High School and Stubbs Elementary School. We will submit the plans tomorrow as required by the Department of Education."
Bock stands by her letter. "I wouldn't have put it in writing if I didn't believe it," she said.
In the middle is the state Department of Education's Turnaround Unit leader, Noreen Lorosa. She recognized a fissure was developing and began to mediate between the union and the administration, drawing in other district staff to talk about solutions. The sides agree they are closer to an agreement.
"We think the differences will be very minimal," Lorosa said.
Last week's letter from the union was not the first sign of trouble at Christina.
The Department of Education confirmed to The News Journal earlier this month that Secretary of Education Lillian Lowery and her deputy secretary, Dan Cruce, had arranged a meeting with the Christina school board leadership because the district's draft plans were "overly broad" and would not be approved as written. At the time, when directly asked in an interview about progress with union agreements, Lyles said there were "draft agreements" in place. She did not express concern in that interview that there might be a problem meeting the state's deadline.
School board member Elizabeth Scheinberg said she was unaware of any problems with meeting today's deadline until late last week.
"I became aware of the issues though teachers," Scheinberg said. "I have not become aware of the issue through the superintendent. She has not addressed it with the [full] board."
The school board -- led by a president who's a vocal critic of the state's Race to the Top efforts -- recently declined to renew Lyles' contract, set to expire in more than a year. Last week a majority of the school board tabled a proposal by the superintendent to extend a two-year contract renewal to other administrators. Next Page 1 | 2 Previous Page Contact Nichole Dobo at 324-2281 or ndobo@delawareonline.com.

event_or_fact.property: We think the differences will be very minimal
At the time, when directly asked in an interview about progress with union agreements
I became aware of the issues though teachers
It is the position of the Christina Education Association that the district has involved us in a process that, while cordial, was not a true partnership
I wouldn't have put it in writing if I didn't believe it

description.hltext_display: Mideast Peace: What If the Palestinians Turn to the UN?
description.content:
ISRAEL is worried, according to press reports in the country, that the United States will not “rush to veto” a planned U.N. Security Council resolution condemning ongoing Israeli settlement construction. The resolution is being drafted by Arab countries exasperated by the failure of the U.S. to pressure the Israelis to halt construction in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, which the U.N. deems illegal. The draft may be introduced as early as this week, according to Israeli media, and the Israeli foreign ministry is reportedly mustering a diplomatic full court press to counter the move. While the U.S. has a longstanding tradition of running interference for Israel at the U.N., the Obama Administration may find itself hard-pressed to veto a resolution condemning the same Israeli behavior that Washington itself has publicly deemed illegitimate and which the Administration has spent months trying in vain to cajole the Israelis into halting.
The Palestinians have insisted, along with the Obama Administration, that Israel refrain from building settlements in occupied territory as a precondition for peace talks. Though the U.S. dropped that effort two weeks ago, the Palestinians continue to press the matter. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had late last year instituted a 10-month partial moratorium on construction, and talks between the two sides finally got under way in August. But the Palestinians called a halt a month later as Israel’s moratorium expired and construction resumed. And the best efforts of the Obama Administration to secure even a temporary reinstatement of the moratorium proved fruitless
While Washington hopes to make progress by conducting parallel negotiations on substantive issues with both sides, the Palestinians and their Arab allies no longer seem willing to stay on that path and leave the matter in U.S. hands. They saw the settlement freeze demand not only as a test of Israeli intentions Netanyahu’s refusal to stop building outside Israel’s 1967 borders has been taken as a sign that he doesn’t accept those borders as a basis for Palestinian statehood but also as a test of the Obama Administration’s willingness to press Israel to accept an outcome in keeping with the international consensus on the terms for a two-state solution. Indeed, the Arab League committee with which Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas consults for his negotiating mandate last Wednesday said there should be no resumption of talks until Washington was ready to publicly commit to the 1967 borders aq the basis for negotiating a two-state solution.
One U.N. option under debate among Arab and Palestinian leaders is to demand U.N. recognition of Palestinian sovereignty in the West Bank, Gaza and East Jerusalem. In recent weeks, Brazil, Argentina and Norway have signaled a willingness to grant such a recognition, and more countries are expected to follow. But even though such a proposal would win near unanimous support at the U.N. and pile on diplomatic pressure, the international body would have no way of implementing Palestinian statehood over Israeli objections
Still, it would leave Israel internationally isolated, making any Israeli claim on keeping any of its settlements in the West Bank and East Jerusalem contingent on Palestinian agreement. That’s why the prospect of the Palestinians going to the U.N. certainly has Israel’s supporters in Washington anxious. The House of Representatives last Wednesday urged President Barack Obama to deny recognition to any unilaterally declared Palestinian state, and to veto “any resolution by the United Nations Security Council to establish or recognize a Palestinian state outside of an agreement negotiated by the two parties.” But with little prospect for such an agreement in the foreseeable future, the Palestinians and their allies appear to be moving beyond two decades of exclusive reliance on U.S. diplomacy to produce an acceptable outcome.
Moreover, going to the Security Council with a more narrowly focused resolution demanding a halt to settlements, as the Palestinians and their Arab League allies appear set to do first, makes things a lot more difficult for Netanyahu: U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon recently reiterated that all Israeli construction in the West Bank and East Jerusalem is illegal, and should be immediately halted. Speaking 10 days ago in Washington, Secretary of State Hillary Clinton reiterated that “we do not accept the legitimacy of continued settlement activity.” And the argument that the matter of settlements should be left to negotiation between the two sides doesn’t hold water, since the very reason it’s being referred to the Security Council is that negotiations have reached a dead end.
Yet even if the U.S. doesn’t feel it can veto such a resolution, it may be tempted to try and soften the blow and use the episode to warn Israel of the consequences of its defiance on the settlement issue by limiting the threats of pressure, or turning the planned resolution into the more nebulous option of a Security Council statement. The response to any such diplomatic maneuvering will certainly be a test of Palestinian and Arab confidence in U.S. diplomacy.—Yahoo.com

event_or_fact.property: there should be no resumption of talks until Washington was ready to publicly commit to the 1967 borders aq the basis for negotiating a two-state solution

description.hltext_display: German auto rebound shortens Christmas break
description.author: MELISSA EDDY
description.content:
BERLIN -- German autoworkers are this year swapping some of their Christmas break with family for time at the factory assembling someone else's gifts - and they don't have a problem with it.
Germany's leading carmakers are making the rare move of cutting holidays short as 2010 draws to a close to meet a surge in demand that is contributing to the nation's strong economic rebound from the recession.
During the worst of the global financial crisis, German automakers took advantage of the nation's traditionally generous end-of-year holidays to idle their factories, keep employees at home and cut costs. But this year most are cutting short those holiday closures, while luxury automakers BMW AG and Daimler AG are even keeping some factories running between Christmas and New Year's.
The VDA automakers' association expects car production for the year to come in at 5.5 million vehicles, 11 percent more than last year and on par with 2008 output. Fueling that growth is a strong demand from Asia, especially China. "Emerging markets are driving the German industry, especially the automakers," said Ferdinand Dudenhoeffer, an auto expert at the University of Dusiburg-Essen. "The high growth rate in Asia will contribute to high growth in the global economy that will set the stage for high growth in the global automobile market," Dudenhoeffer wrote in an analyst note.
The auto industry is the backbone of Germany's export-oriented economy and has contributed strongly to the 3.6 percent growth predicted by the nation's central bank this year.
German automakers are also benefiting from the recovering U.S. market, which has begun to emerge from the global financial downturn.
The big three carmakers there - General Motors Co., Ford Motor Co. and Chrysler Group - will keep plants shut over the Christmas holiday, as usual. The only exception will be Chrysler's Jefferson North plant in Detroit, which will be working one shift due to increased demand for the new Jeep Grand Cherokee and the launch of the Dodge Durango.
German companies like Munich-based BMW AG are enjoying a broader rise in demand. It recorded a 19.7 percent jump in sales for November of 2010 compared with the same month of 2009 - driven by markets in Germany, the United States and China. The company expects to sell more than 1.4 million cars worldwide by year's end. "Right now we are running at full capacity," said Jochen Mueller, a spokesman at the factory in Leipzig, which turns out 750 cars a day, including BMW's popular X1 urban sport utility vehicle. "Above all, the X1 is in very high demand and we decided to keep the factory open between Christmas and New Year's," Mueller said. Leipzig assembly worker Marcus Henze said this would be the first of eight years at BMW where he is returning to work between the official Christmas and New Year's government holidays. "Of course we would rather be home with families, but most people are OK with it," Henze said. "Motivation is very high." The move appears to be unique in Europe. While British luxury automaker Jaguar-Land Rover say demand is up, they have been able to meet it through increased overtime, as has Sweden's Volvo. In France, neither Renault nor PSA Peugeot Citroen were changing their holiday schedules, while Italy's Fiat still hasn't returned to full production since the recession.
In Germany, Daimler, maker of Mercedes-Benz cars, said most of its 16 factories are reducing their year-end closure times to between Dec. 23 and Jan. 3. "On average, the closures are about one week shorter this year in all of our factories than they were in the past two years of the crisis," said Dominique Albrecht, a Daimler spokeswoman, noting that decisions on closure times are up to each individual plant.
One factory in the northern port of Hamburg, where axles and other components for Mercedes Benz sedans are produced, will stay open between the official Christmas and New Year's.
Volkswagen AG said that "given the current high demand" its European factories will stay open through Dec. 23 - last year most closed for the year on Dec. 19.
Those where the Tiguan compact SUV and Passat sedan are assembled will reopen on the first Monday of the New Year, while other VW plants resume work on Jan. 10, VW spokesman Christoph Adomat said. "In the past two years, the trend has been more in the other direction," said Adomat. Volkswagen, Europe's largest automaker, is predicting a full-year delivery record of more than 7 million vehicles.
BMW Leipzig employee Mike Flieher doesn't mind the year-end hours. "Basically, we view this as a positive," Flieher said. "We are happy to be busy." ---

event_or_fact.property: this would be the first of eight years at BMW where he is returning to work between the official Christmas and New Year's government holidays

Of course we would rather be home with families, but most people are OK with it; Motivation is very high.

description.author: winston.ckw@gmail.com (Winston
description.content:
{pgbox version=1.0b type=footer } {/pgbox} {pgbox version=1.0b type=footer } {/pgbox} We've just publish a review on the . Here's a snip ...
Today, we take a look at the QPad HeatoN gaming mouse pad. It's made using a 3 layer construction method and meaures 43.5 x 36.5 cm, with a total weight of 550g. The bottom layer is made from a high quality cross weave natural rubber base for extra grip. There is a second layer that is made from ABS plastic and gives the mouse pad extra stability and weight. And finally, the surface layer is made from a durable Carbytek™ plastic, and gives gamers the smooth playing surface that they need for micro precision gaming.
Read the rest of the review here ... http://www.funkykit.com/component/content/article/56-accessories/6782-review-qpad-heaton-gaming-mouse-pad.html

LOS ANGELES - De Nederlandse film Oorlogswinter van regisseur Martin Koolhoven gaat half maart draaien in de Amerikaanse bioscopen. Dat heeft de Amerikaanse distributeur Sony Pictures Classics gemeld op zijn website.
Oorlogswinter is de verfilming van het gelijknamige boek van Jan Terlouw over de 14-jarige Michiel (Martijn Lakemeier) die met zijn familie probeert de laatste winter van de Tweede Wereldoorlog te overleven. De film trok in Nederland rond de 850.000 bezoekers.
De Nederlandse film werd begin 2010 aangekocht door Sony toen hij op een shortlist stond voor de Oscar voor beste buitenlandse productie. Uiteindelijk sleepte Oorlogswinter geen nominatie in de wacht. De productie werd ook verkocht aan onder meer Australië, Ierland, Engeland, Duitsland, Nieuw-Zeeland, Frankrijk, Oostenrijk en China.

Oorlogswinter is de verfilming van het gelijknamige boek van Jan Terlouw over de 14-jarige Michiel (Martijn Lakemeier) die met zijn familie probeert de laatste winter van de Tweede Wereldoorlog te overleven. De film trok in Nederland rond de 850.000 bezoekers.
De Nederlandse film werd begin 2010 aangekocht door Sony toen hij op een shortlist stond voor de Oscar voor beste buitenlandse productie. Uiteindelijk sleepte Oorlogswinter geen nominatie in de wacht. De productie werd ook verkocht aan onder meer Australië, Ierland, Engeland, Duitsland, Nieuw-Zeeland, Frankrijk, Oostenrijk en China.

EINDHOVEN - Eindhoven Airport heeft dit jaar de grens van twee miljoen passagiers doorbroken. Dit jaar vlogen 2,14 miljoen passagiers van en naar Eindhoven Airport. Dat is een kwart meer dan in 2009 (1.712.000). Dat liet de regionale luchthaven woensdag weten.
Volgens de regionale luchthaven is een toename van het aantal nieuwe bestemmingen de belangrijkste oorzaak van de groei. Vanaf Eindhoven Airport kan worden gevlogen naar 32 lijndienstbestemmingen. Eind 2009 waren dat er nog 23.
Voor volgend jaar verwacht Eindhoven Airport 15 procent meer passagiers te vervoeren.

Trafikken klarer op midt i Europas snekaos
description.content: Meldingen fra Europas stÃ¸rste lufthavne er, at trafikken onsdag kommer tÃ¦ttere pÃ¥ normal drift.

Kevin Pietersen insists England must simply forget about their trouncing in Perth as they begin their preparations for the fourth Ashes Test on Boxing Day.
Pietersen himself could muster only three runs in two innings - after his career-best 227 in the preceding landslide victory in Adelaide - and he is as keen as anyone to put the WACA behind him.
"The key to us being successful on this Ashes trip would just be to forget about last week - learn from the mistakes we made, but just forget about last week," he said.
He was one of three frontline England batsmen to fall lbw to Mitchell Johnson, for nine runs between them, in a first-innings collapse which handed the initiative to Australia.
England must therefore begin at the MCG level in the series again, at 1-1 with two to play.
Pietersen reports England came to the conclusion, immediately after their 267-run setback in Perth, that they must leave that experience in the past if they are to retain the urn after all.
He added: "The open and honest meeting we had the evening the game finished was a very good meeting.
"We have left that, and it's time to look forward now.
"We've got to learn from the mistakes we made - and we'll be better prepared come Sunday."

event_or_fact.property: The key to us being successful on this Ashes trip would just be to forget about last week - learn from the mistakes we made, but just forget about last week
The open and honest meeting we had the evening the game finished was a very good meeting.
We've got to learn from the mistakes we made - and we'll be better prepared come Sunday.

description.author: Hürriyet Avrupa
description.content:
22 Aralık 2010
Avrupa'da kar yağışı ve soğuk hava hayatı olumsuz etkiliyor. İşte ülke ülke hava durumu... BELÇİKA
Hava sıcaklığının eksi 12'ye kadar düştüğü Belçika'da da hava ulaşımında büyük aksaklıklar yaşandı. Verilen bilgiye göre dün bir çok uçak seferi iptal edilirken yoğun gecikmeler de yaşandı. Otoyollarda zaman zaman kazalar meydana gelse de trafik akışının sağlandığı açıklandı. Yetkililer "Bugün kar yağışı beklenmiyor. Ancak hava sıcaklığı eksi derecelerde kalacak" bilgisini verdiler.
İSVİÇRE
İsviçre bu haftaya daha yumuşak bir hava ile başladı. Başta Zürih, Basel ve Cenevre olmak üzere havaalanlarında herhangi bir aksama olmadı. Hava sıcaklığı geceleri sıfırın altına düşüyor. Yetkililer sabah erken saatlerde yollarda buzlanma olabileceğini belirtiyorlar. Hafta başında başlayan yağmur ve karla karışık yağmurun Noel tatili bitimine kadar devam edeceği açıklandı.
AVUSTURYA
Avusturya'daki yolcular kötü hava şartlarından çok, diğer ülkelerdeki havaalanlarının kapalı olmasından dolayı mağdur oldular. Dün Viyana havaalanında 500 yolcunun mahsur kaldığını açıklayan yetkililer "Frankfurt, Londra, Paris ve Brüksel havaalanlarının geçici olarak kapanması nedeniyle uçaklar Viyana'dan kalkamadı. Bu nedenle yolcular perişan saatlerce beklemek zorunda kaldılar" dedi.
DANİMARKA
Danimarka'da hava sıcaklığı eksi 21,5 dereceye kadar düştü. Yetkililer son 15 yılda aralık ayında sıcaklığın ilk kez bu seviyeye ulaştığını bildirdiler. Rayların donması sonucu tren seferleri iptal edilirken havaalanlarında dün sabah uçakların kardan çıkarılması için yoğun uğraş verildiği belirtildi. Noel tatili için havaalanlarına giden Danimarkalılar evlerine dönmek zorunda kaldılar. İngiltere, Hollanda ve Fransa'da binlerce Danimarkalının mahsur kaldığı ve ülkelerine dönemediği bildirildi. Bugün ve yarın tipi şeklinde yoğun kar yağışı bekleniyor. Yetkililer "Havaalanlarındaki kaos sürecek" dediler.
HOLLANDA
Hollanda da kar yağışı, aşırı soğuklar ve buzlanmanın etkisi altında. Hız sınırının otoyollarda saatte 50 kilometreye düşürülmesine rağmen cuma gününden bu yana ülkede 10 milyon Euro’nun üzerinde hasarlı trafik kazası meydana geldi. Hız sınırına özellikle ağır vasıtaların uymadığı belirlendi. Schiphol havalimanın hava trafiğine açık olmasına rağmen Londra başta olmak üzere Avrupa’da bazı havalimanlarının kapanı olması dolayısıyla uçak seferlerinde büyük aksamalar oluyor. Meteoroloji uzmanları, kar yağışının ve soğuk hava dalgasının önümüzdeki günlerde de devam edeceğini duyurdular.
FRANSA
Fransa'da hava ve kara ulaşımı dün de olumsuz etkilendi. Paris havaalanında bir çok uçak gecikmeli olarak havalanabildi. Kar yağışı nedeniyle Charles de Gaulle Havaalanında 3 bin yolcunun mahsur kaldığı açıklandı. Marsilya'da havaalanı çalışanlarının grevi bekleme sürelerini daha da artırdı. Air France yetkilileri, kar yağışından dolayı sadece başkent Paris'te meydana gelen maddi zararın 25 ile 35 milyon Euro arasında olduğunu bildirdiler.
İNGİLTERE
Kar yağışı ve soğuk hava, İngiltere’de ulaşımı olumsuz yönde etkiliyor. Ülkenin en işlek ve büyük havaalanı Heathrow’dan karşılıklı uçuşların sadece üçte biri yapılabiliyor. Londra yakınlarındaki Gatwick havaalanı dün yeniden uçuşlara açıldı, ancak bu havaalanından da kısıtlı sayıda sefer gerçekleştirilebiliyor. Demiryolu ulaşımı da soğuk havadan olumsuz etkileniyor. Şehirlerarası tren seferleri yapan East Coast şirketi, elektrik hattında soğuk hava nedeniyle oluşan arızadan dolayı seferlerini gerçekleştiremiyor. Londra ile Paris ve Brüksel arasında hızlı tren seferleri yapan Eurostar ise az sayıda sefer yapabiliyor. Meteoroloji yetkilileri, soğuk havanın İngiltere’de hafta boyunca etkili olacağını bildiriyor.

description.author: ROBIN BROWN
description.content:
Next Page 1 | 2 Previous Page WILMINGTON -- Kevin Thomas walked into the toy shop with his 5-year-old grandson Tahyrin Neol, whose eyes grew wide at the sight of tables piled with goodies from building sets to doll babies. Tahyrin quickly picked up a toy caterpillar of soft, bendy, jelly-like material and began to wag it.
"Wait, wait, look around first," his grandfather said with a smile, patting the boy's head.
They could have been shopping anywhere, but this special toy shop belongs to the .Open right before Christmas each year, the shop has customers come by appointment only and, because all the toys were donated for the needy, no one pays when they check out.
The Rev. Thomas Laymon, mission president and chief executive officer, says he has seen proof that need is rising because of the poor economy. Its programs help the homeless and jobless, he said, but also the working poor who live paycheck to paycheck, barely covering bills. Laymon calls the shop an "outstanding example ... of the Christmas spirit."
And recipients, including Thomas, were grateful. "This really helps my budget," he said. "It's really nice, very helpful."
Money is tight for Thomas, who also has a granddaughter, 6-year-old Trinity Thomas, staying at his Wilmington home.
"They stay with me right now," he said. "One mom's incarcerated and the other's having a hard time right now."
He let Tahyrin pick his own gifts -- an All Geared Up race-car construction set and Tinkertoys -- after telling him, "You need something to keep you busy."
For Tiffany, Thomas chose a baby doll and Play-Doh set, and mission staff member Jim Smith provided a roll of gift wrap and tape as his visit ended.
"One of the schools that collected for us got that," Smith said. "Really nice."
Staffer Jill Goldner said the effort got a big boost just before opening Friday. Brandywine Valley Baptist Church in Talleyville gave hundreds of gifts from a toy drive it held, she said.
"It's great, because every year ... we don't know how many toys we'll get, but God just seems to work it out that we get what we need," Goldner said.(2 of 2)Two rooms of the mission's new family shelter hold the toys and another has coats and winterwear. From them, needy parents get to pick two toys or a toy and coat for each child. Janice Laymon, who directs special projects and the new shelter, said hundreds of parents she registered for free toys would have had no gifts to give their children without the toy shop.
As families filed in this week for their appointed shopping times, she said, "We've been really busy."
Repeat toy shop customer Deborah Brown of Wilmington said she appreciates the chance to pick gifts for her daughter, NyiRay, 9, and granddaughter, Jasmine, 13.
Brown, who said she enjoys shopping, picked out games and dolls for the girls in no time. She said the choices were easy because "that's what they like."
Shopping took longer for first-time guest Gabriel Avilla of Wilmington. He picked a basketball, football, two Barbies, a Wacky Words game and a game with a decorated cup used to catch a ball bearing an image of an eyeball. He said the toys will make Christmas "better, much better" for his children -- Josue, 9, Monsarat, 7, and Jeslly, 4.
Without them, the mushroom-farm worker said all they would get is "something cheap."
The situation of every shopper is different, Goldner said, including shelter residents. "So many are trying to mend fences and get back with their families," she said.
Resident Harry Zayas said, "I was on the street for two years doing heroin and now I'm here. Now I'm clean and getting closer to my family. ... I really appreciate all they do for us here."
When he was homeless and on drugs, Zayas didn't see his daughter, Jaisha Marie, whose name is tattooed on his arm.
On Monday, he picked out a soft Baby Bella doll and a Dora the Explorer memory game for her.
Zayas fought tears, saying he barely believed it when mission staff said he could have two gifts for her. "I was so happy," he said, "I was crying all day." Next Page 1 | 2 Previous Page Contact robin brown at 324-2856 or rbrown@delawareonline.com.

description.hltext_display: LG Optimus 2X announced - Expect March release
description.author: winstonchim@live.co.uk (QQ
description.content:
Dual-core smartphones (or should I say Superphone) coming soon ... real soon.
"Like an impatient, present hungry child who just can’t wait until Christmas (or CES in this case), LG on Thursday unwrapped its much rumored Optimus 2X dual core superphone, running on Nvidia’s Tegra 2 chip and sporting Google’s Android operating system.
... The 4-inch WVGA display Optimus 2X sports 8GB of memory, a microSD slot for adding 32GB more and a 1,500 mAh battery. It also has an impressive 8-megapixel rear-facing camera and a 1.3-megapixel model on the front for video calling. Likewise, seeing as it is a DLNA (Digital Living Network Alliance) device, it’s compatible with devices like HDTVs."
Source: RCR

description.hltext_display: 我的18岁高中女学生缠上我了
Shigeru Miyamoto tells us why Nintendo is still the king of motion control
description.content:
2011 is going to be a big year for Nintendo. After years of effortlessly topping Christmas lists worldwide, its DS and Wii consoles have hit a sales plateau. Meanwhile, Apple has muscled in to the handheld gaming market with its touchscreen devices and rivals Sony and Microsoft have cheekily embraced motion-control with their technically superior consoles.
Nintendo has a lot to worry about.
So why is Shigeru Miyamoto looking so cheerful?
The Nintendo linchpin, whose business card describes him as "Senior Managing Director, Member of the Board, General Manager, Entertainment Analysist and Development Division", is currently waving his arms at a TV screen, demonstrating his next project for the Wii, The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword, due for release in 2011.
At the age of 58, but the looks of a man in his late thirties, Miyamoto clearly still loves to play. With ear-length dark hair surrounding a round face that seems to be designed for smiling, he shows off the improved attack and defence controls for Skyward Sword grinning with boyish enthusiasm at the screen. His movements are as fluid and expert as you'd expect, but it's the joy with which he plays that is remarkable.The man who gave the world Mario, Zelda, Pikmin, Nintendogs and Starfox has clearly lost none of his love for his work. But where exactly is his company going, now that even Microsoft is talking about catering for "Wii graduates"? "I don't think the Wii is something that people need to graduate from", he says through his translator. "Of course, I am happy that motion is fashionable now. But when we make games, we are not trying to produce trendy products. It needs to be an experience that's meaningful, and the motion control needs to add something. So our new Zelda game takes motion control and adds something to the game to make you feel like you're part of the adventure."I think our rivals need to find what it is they have to offer that's new". Like the entire stable of classic games that Miyamoto has produced, the latest Zelda title will be a Nintendo exclusive, a game that exerts a commercial pull so powerful that people will buy consoles especially to play it. At the time of our meeting, the game is "over half complete". Presumably, Mario Kart looks great in 3D.For the briefest of moments, Miyamoto looks like Pocket-lint has stolen a prized biscuit from his private cookie jar, since no announcement of Mario Kart in 3D has been made. Then he smiles."You're right. We've found that pulling the camera far back to observe the car racing works really well"."But you must remember that we have been experimenting with 3D in one way or another for over 20 years. The 3DS is another opportunity to do even more".Intriguingly, Nintendo claims that the 3DS will also be able to play back 3D video content. This could be a boon for parents who don't want to stump up for a new 3D TV simply so their offspring can watch How to Train your Dragon 3,000 times. It's a whole new market for Nintendo to conquer, though in the absence of confirmed rights deals, Miyamoto seems keen to downplay it."When I was young", he says, "I had a stereoscopic movie viewer thing, and I became fascinated by the images. Maybe you could have short 3D clips you can watch over and over again. It's well suited to a device like the 3DS. It is also technically possible to put a full 2-hour movie on there and watch it too".So, after 2010 in which he found time to receive a BAFTA in between designing New Super Mario Bros., Super Mario Galaxy 2 and Skyward Sword, Miyamoto isn't looking forward to much of a break in 2011. Does he ever allow himself to go on holiday?"The thing is that I enjoy going to work so much that the only time I take for vacation is for my family's sake. Making and playing games for a living is such fun".Each game he makes, he sees as being for a slightly different audience, with challenges of its own. "With Super Mario Galaxy 2, for example, we were flexing our gaming muscles. The sense of satisfaction from making a difficult game is amazing. If you finish that game, you'll be able to play almost any game in the world".But does he find any common ground between his various games?"Look, everything I create has a little bit of me in it, and there are some common factors. Mario will never end up in an overly violent game, yet all these years he gets through games by punching and kicking".And with that Miyamoto picks up his controllers again and starts punching and kicking. And grinning.
© copyright Pocket-lint 2010

event_or_fact.property: why Nintendo is still the king of motion control 2011 is going to be a big year for Nintendo

description.hltext_display: Microsoft podría lanzar una nueva versión de Windows para ARM en el CES
description.content:
Por si no teníamos suficientes novedades apuntadas en nuestra agenda para el Consumer Electronics Show (CES) de enero, personas muy cercanas a Microsoft aseguran que el gigante del software presentará un nuevo Windows ejecutable con tecnología ARM.
Al parecer, este nuevo software compatible con la arquitectura de ARM estará orientado a dispositivos como tablets y portátiles, según explican las fuentes.
Al parecer, el nuevo software también será capaz de trabajar con procesadores de Intel y AMD.
Esta información ha saltado hace escasas horas y proviene de personas muy cercanas a la compañía de Redmond, que por supuesto no quieren ser identificadas, y es recogida por medios como Bloomberg, AllThingsDigital o The Wall Street Journal.
Recordemos que actualmente los procesadores de ARM dominan el mercado de los tablets, en el que Microsoft está muy interesado. Este nuevo sistema operativo le daría a Microsoft la oportunidad de luchar contra iOS, que domina este segmento con el iPad, y de contrarrestar la fuerza de Android, que ya tiene a punto su SO para tablets Honeycomb.
Además, según las últimas informaciones los de Redmond van a presentar también en el CES sus nuevas tabletas.
En cualquier caso, los nuevos dispositivos de Microsoft con este supuesto nuevo Windows podrían llegar demasieado tarde como para competir en el segmento tablet ya que no se verán el año que viene, sino que según las informaciones de The Wall Street Journal podrían tardar hasta dos años en lanzarse al mercado.
vINQulos
Bloomberg, AllThingsDigital o The Wall Street Journal
